item.title: Project 4: Detecting Health Insurance Fraud
item.description: Link to Github The Problem: Overwhelming Costs of Healthcare Fraud According to the Institute of Medicine, health insurance fraud is among the top 5 “Sources of Waste” in American Health Care spending (Shrank et al., 2019). A study published in the International Journal of Academic Medicine showed that the cost of litigation and risk management is a significant expenditure associated with health care fraud, often exceeding the direct costs of fraudulent claims (Dippolito et al.

item.title: Project 3: Predicting Housing Prices in Ames, Iowa
item.description: Link to Github Repository Background There are many qualities of a residential home that determine its worth and price outside of just the number of rooms and square footage. Taking a closer look at 81 residential variables from Ames, Iowa between 2006 to 2010, we are able to use various machine learning methods to determine features of a home in this region that are important to predict sale prices. In this regression analysis, the R2 value across select regression models helped determine which model best fit the dataset and predicted housing prices.
